data.title: Board Of Elections
data.text:
New York Online Voter Registration

You can use the Board of Electionsâ€™ Online Voter Registration system to register to vote or to update your voter registration information.

Updated information could include providing Warren County Board of Elections with your new name, new address, or changing your party enrollment. Completed applications are sent to Warren County Board of Elections for approval and processing.

To register you will need to use a NY.Gov ID. If you have previously used NY.Gov with another agency, you may use the same login to access the Online Voter Registration portal. If you have not used NY.Gov you will need to create an account.

The Road to 2024:

2024 POLITICAL CALENDAR Quad-Fold.pdf

September 11th/12th: Certification of November General ballot by State and County Boards of Election

September 20th: Military/Special Federal/UOCAVA ballot transmission deadline

October 21st: LAST day to file change of address with County Board of Elections prior to November General

October 26th: LAST day to receive Absentee application for November General Election

October 26th: LAST day to receive Military/Special Federal/UOCAVA Absentee application for November General Election if NOT already registered

October 26th-November 3rd: EARLY VOTING

October 29th: LAST day to receive Military/Special Federal/UOCAVA Absentee application for November General Election

November 4th: LAST day to apply in person for an Absentee Ballot or a Military/Special Federal/UOCAVA ballot

November 5th: LAST day to postmark absentee ballot, due to office no later than November 12th, or hand deliver for drop-off

November 5th: GENERAL ELECTION 2024

November 20th: Audit, Canvass, Recanvass due for General Election

November 30th: Certification of November General Election
